result.execSummary:
The defendant Marlene M. Taylor was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Waushara Co Case No. 2015CF000081

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.
Defendant to undergo an alcohol and other drug assessment and comply with any further counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Marlene M. Taylor

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 15CF-81 and 15CF-22 - Both Cases Called @ 2:25 PM: Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Global resolution recited by ADA.  Def and counsel concur w/State's recital.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. 15CF-81 INFO:  Plea:  NC  Also accepts State's Motion to Amend Ct 2 to Misd Level BJump contrary to s. 946.49(1) Plea:  NC  15CF-22 Plea Ct 1 (OAR) Plea:  NC  Court accepts pleas and enters JOC.  Ct 2 of 15CF-22 and Ct 3 of 15CF-81 and also 15TR-202   all DRI.  Subsequent offender provision also dismissed as to Ct 1 of 15CF-81 reducing to Misd Level charge.   No Statement offered.  The Court:  S/W - 2 yrs probation - all 3 charges.  Ct 1 of 15CF-81 only - 15 days WCJ - Report 10/1/2015 at 8:00 PM - 6 days TS credit - Huber, No GT.  Conditions as to all:  AODA,  the defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician; DNA sample to be provided today; Court Costs plus DNA surcharge - any bond posted to be applied - 60 DTP or PP.  Appeal Rights Given.  As to Unpaid Financial Obligations:  Def states she can resume payments next month.  Has job interviews set up for next week.  Request to continue payments.  PP imposed as of 10/1/2015 of $100.00 per month.  No contempt finding imposed but doubling required payments on payment plan.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Szilagyi states matter can be set for plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 02:15 pm.

15CF-22 and 15CF-81 - Both Cases Called @ 1:50 PM: Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  15CF-81:  Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Preliminary Hearing and Time Limits discussed. Defendant wishes to waive preliminary hearing in its entirety. Court questions defendant and accepts waiver of preliminary hearing.   Finds probable cause supporting the charges in the Complaint.  ARGN to proceed today.  Def states she is currently living in Marquette Co - mailing address only in Wautoma.  Court sees this as a possible TAD referral.   INFO Filed - Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  NGP received and entered.  STC Scheduled as to all pending matters -  NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 21, 2015 at 09:25 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson requesting additional time for DE to obtain valid DL.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: 11:02 am case called. Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading waived.  Counsel addressed-court questions defendant regarding counsel. Requests to meet with DA to discuss possible resolution. 11:10 back on the record- DA makes statement regarding possible resolution. Court questions defendant regarding preliminary hearing and time limits. Defendant wishes to waive the time limits for the preliminary hearing. Court questions the defendant and accepts waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing. Matter to be set for in-person status first week of May.  Status conference scheduled for May 8, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Prior: W11229 County Road Bc, Hancock, WI 54943
No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.    Complete ID process with the Sheriff's Department.

Case Called @ 3:18 PM: Defendant Marlene M. Taylor in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  ADA serves a copy of the Complaint.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def does not wish counsel today.  Court confirms counsel of record in Portage Co.  Def has not advised her attorney of these new charges.  Her attorney in Portage Co is an SPD appointment.  Def referred to SPD for eligibility process.  IA  Scheduled - NOH Given.  Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.  Initial appearance scheduled for March 31, 2015 at 11:00 am.
